basics.name: Josh Holloway
basics.label: Software Engineer
basics.summary: An enthusiastic, all round developer who is always looking to improve. I'm a quick learner and love learning new things. The ability to see the bigger picture means I am able to quickly find the source of problems and fix them. I've got a passion for distributed systems, and having been exposed to micro-services at scale I've got a good understanding of the complexities that come with them.

work.summary: Developing and maintaining highly available, distributed systems on top of an in house Golang based micro-service platform. Peer reviewing code. Identifying and fixing performance bottlenecks/poorly designed code. Automating infrastructure changes through the use of tools such as Puppet and Terraform. Maintaining existing shared infrastructure (Cassandra, RabbitMQ, Zookeeper) and investigating new technologies (Docker, Consul, Kubernetes)
highlights: Refactored underlying Golang framework; removing inefficent calls to core services, increasing reslience to failure and improving uptime
Replaced Jenkins with CircleCI. - Reducing costs and improving developer efficency
Refactored puppet repository, removing over 50,000 lines of unnecessary code without any breaking changes
Used docker to give developers the ability to setup their entire development environment in 1 command

work.summary: Designing and developing an microservice based e-commerce platform using a mixture of technologies including Node.js, Golang, Docker, RabbitMQ and PostgreSQL. Integrating with multiple third party APIs (payment providers, shipping service providers).
highlights: Automated label printing, increasing efficency and reducing number of incorrectly labeled / shipped orders almost zero.

work.summary: Developing and maintaining custom software applications at all levels of the system. Designing and documenting solutions (for distribution both internally and to clients) Maintaining both MySQL and MongoDB databases. Designing database schemas; both relational and denormalised. Maintaining and supporting legacy applications built in a variety of programming languages, including; PHP, .NET 2.0 and Adobe Flex. Setting up testing environments and performing regression testing and UAT's
highlights: Replaced legacy Adobe Flex based UI with current generation HTML/JavaScript based ones
Spent time on client site in Italy to assist in debugging issues with their platform when receiving responses to API calls. Successfully finding the cause and helping implement fix
Lead research into new class of services using node. Prototyped replacement of legacy CDR processor (written in .NET) with node.js based version
